snippet: Izzat Ibrahim al-Douri, the most senior member of Saddam Hussein’s entourage, called on Sunnis to keep up the pressure until Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki is toppled.
abstract: Izzat Ibrahim al-Douri, leader of Baath Party in Iraq, encourages antigovernment Sunni Muslim protesters to stand their ground until Prime Min Nuri al-Maliki is forced out; Douri was most senior member of Saddam Hussein's entourage and was not captured.
lead_paragraph: Izzat Ibrahim al-Douri, the most senior member of Saddam Hussein’s entourage, called on Sunnis to keep up the pressure until Prime Minister Nuri al-Maliki is toppled.

headline.seo: Baath Party Leader Encourages Sunni Protests in Iraq
headline.main: Baath Leader Urges Sunnis to Protest Iraqi Premier
headline.print_headline: Baath Leader in Iraq Urges Sunnis To Protest Until Maliki Is Ousted

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
